content: property of netty-knitz worry monster pattern my name is lynnette and i have been crocheting a number of years if you have any questions about the pattern you can contact me via my email lynihughes@hotmail co uk or my facebook page https //www facebook com/netty-knitz-1498594320424723/ this pattern is for personal use only the pattern or parts of it may not be reproduced published online or printed altered or resold you can sell items made from this pattern provided that they are handmade by yourself in a limited number and you give credit to the designer please add the following lines to your item description and any item you are selling „this worry monster is handmade by your name from a design by netty knitz materials size 3 5 mm or us e/4 crochet hook stitch marker cotton yarn double knit -for this i used stylecraft classique cotton 50g of main colour and small amounts of others dark blue a pale blue b turquoise c white and black toy stuffing yarn needle abbreviations this pattern is written in us terms chain chain single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease single_crochet two stitches together magic_ring magic_ring see tutorial link property of netty-knitz notes start with the legs and make the arms before round 31 as will be crocheting them in as we go make the mouth before round 35 the monster is crochet in the round use a stitch marker right leg r1 magic_ring 8 single_crochet into magic_ring do not join place stitch marker at beginning of each subsequent round 8 r2 single_crochet increase in each stitch 16 r3 *single_crochet increase single_crochet in one stitch * repeat around 24 r4 - r5 single_crochet around 24 r6 - decrease 8 times single_crochet in next 8 stitches 16 r7 single_crochet around 16 r8 decrease 4 times single_crochet in next 8 stitches 12 r9 - r10 single_crochet around 12 chain 5 for the groin fasten_off left leg r1 magic_ring 8 single_crochet into magic_ring do not join place stitch marker at beginning of each subsequent round 8 r2 single_crochet increase in each stitch 16 r3 *single_crochet increase single_crochet in one stitch * repeat around 24 r4 - r5 single_crochet around 24 r6 single_crochet in 8 stitches decrease 8 times 16 r7 single_crochet around 16 r8 single_crochet in 8 stitches decrease 4 times 12 r9 - r10 single_crochet around 12 r11 single_crochet in two stitches do not fasten_off stuff both feet property of netty-knitz body here is where we join the legs together and commence the body r1 - with the left leg still on your hook single_crochet 10 5 of these will be down the chain made on the right leg see picture continuing around the right leg r1 continued single_crochet increase single_crochet in next 6 stitches single_crochet in next 10 stitches 5 of these will be the other side of the chain made and 5 around the left leg single_crochet increase single_crochet in next 6 stitches single_crochet in the next 20 stitches
